pros: great place to work with many opportunities

pros: Nice and friendly supportive environment
cons: Too far from where I live

pros: I'm not one for evening and weekend work, and I'm a clerical worker so that's immediately a plus. Plenty of annual leave, a good pension and lots of discounts and perks come with working for the nhs. I feel like I'm really well looked after in my job, something which I haven't really felt before. It's varied and challenging, and definitely very rewarding!
cons: Just the usual stresses that come with holding down a full time job. I don't feel like there's anything much that can be improved on - I have lovely supportive managers and don't feel as though the health board expect impossible things from its staff, at least from my own point of vie in a non clinical role.

job_title: Medical Secretary and Rota Coordinator In Gynaecology in Carmarthen, Wales
pros: Good pension. Great staff. The annual leave and pay scale is fair. The NHS is a carer. I like that once you are a member of the NHS you are looked after by other staff and the company.
cons: Working for such a big organisation with many different departments and mangers can be difficult when there are changes put in place as it can take a while to iron out the creases.

pros:

Good benefits and perks that are constantly updating
Access to support when required
Great managerial relationship

job_title: Senior Biomedical Scientist in Swansea, Wales
pros:
Great work life balance. Plenty of annual leave. Friendly team and management. 
Clear objectives and goals. Good management structure.
cons: Staffing can be an issue occasionally. Some strategic changes are influencing the make up of services and hospitals now.

pros: we get paid on time monthly
cons: no management support. Trying to close down wards. No courses training allowed (under staffed) Expecting nurses to do Psychiatrists jobs. Moving wards. No rooms on A & E for assessments of mental health patient's. No answers to Datix. De moralised staff. No one to talk to if bullied my staff members.  Lousy food. Cutting pay

pros: Good pay, rewarding work when not under immense pressure.
cons: High expectations from managers whilst working with “not fit for purpose” equipment .

pros: Learn many skills and many trainings available for staff
cons: Long hours and pay is not reflecting the amount of work
